intro: Huberodaphne longicaudata, commonly known as the long-tailed daphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Daphniphyllaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences with distinctive red bracts. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests.
